Ratings.comment: Shes wonderful. recitations pre-work are kinda difficult, but you can turn them in again after rec, the TA explains all questions. layout makes class hard to fail as long as you pay attention in lec & put in the effort for rec. lectures are recorded on zoom. exams are medium difficulty, but I think she is a relatively lenient grader. really kind.
he is a super nice guy but not the best at teaching and his tests are super hard

He is really interested in the material, but his lectures are so boring it's hard to listen to. He gives you a hard copy of the notes, which is nice, as well as study guides for each chapter. He's nice, but boring lectures and hard tests. To prepare, go over his study guides, old tests, and his online quizzes, as he sometimes repeats questions.
Hollick seems to be really into the material but is incapable of making it interesting to students. Very nice guy but maybe not the best teacher. Read the textbook and take your own notes
Hollick's lectures are boring, but he's a nice guy and eager to meet with students during office hours. When preparing for his exams, READ THE BOOK.

Shes wonderful. recitations pre-work are kinda difficult, but you can turn them in again after rec, the TA explains all questions. layout makes class hard to fail as long as you pay attention in lec & put in the effort for rec. lectures are recorded on zoom. exams are medium difficulty, but I think she is a relatively lenient grader. really kind.

Dr. Cole is profound. She can make anyone love molecular genetics and is truly an inspiration. She genuinely cares about her students and is passionate about her class. I would take every class possible with her. Easily the best STEM professor at Ohio State. I want to be her daughter.

Dr. Cole is a phenomenal professor who truly cares about her students! Her exams are very fair and she provides a practice exam and lots of in class activities with similar questions to the exams. Super approachable and very knowledgeable.

Dr. Cole is an amazing teacher, but the subject is not easy so you need to be prepared to study and work hard. She tests for understanding, not memorization, so if you don't really understand the material you will have trouble finishing her tests on time. Her standards are high but very fair. Overall my favorite professor at OSU.

This 1st year course is a great way to get involved. Dr. Cole is so intelligent, and I really look up to her. She includes great discussions in this class and overall, I really enjoyed it. Some readings, two 2-pg single spaced essays, a few paragraphs here and there for reflections and that's about it! I def will look for Cole for fut scheduling.

Dr. Cole is such a smart teacher but she gives out crazy amounts of difficult readings and unacheivable tasks. I think she also hates to give out full credit on anything you would turn into her. She gives great leactures and smart herself but gives out unrealistic work.

Dr Cole is a fantastic and super approachable professor. She really loves the material and wants her students to do well. I'm not sure what all the other reviews are talking about in terms of her exams. Yes, for the most part the class took up most of the allotted time, but none of us were scrambling to write answers down as time ran out.

She explains well but the exams are hard to finish. If you want to perform well, do not spend much time on any question because the exams are very long. It is better to have a half correct answer on some questions than just not even write a word on the last question you attempt. She also doesn't post the key to sample exams.
You need to take advantage of office hours if youre struggling and still expect a B

Dr. Coles exams were very long and almost the whole class had to stay past the allotted exam time just to finish or were not able to finish at all. Practice exams were given, but not for the final which made it much harder to study for the final as there is so much material covered in lecture.
She teaches the first half of MolGen 4606 and is very into problem/puzzle solving. If you practice you'll do well!

She's a great lecturer and makes difficult concepts very comprehensible. The slides are available on Carmen, but attending class is worth it for the additional detail and "pop activities" for credit.  This really is one of those classes where you actually have to study in addition to going to class. There's also no curve, FYI.
Great teacher. very descriptive and fun! Make sure to answer her questions!!

You prefer super looong exams which you can't finish in time, then take it. Otherwise, AVOID HER! She is a good professor, but these loooong exams made me hate the class, I had to drop it and retake next semester with different professor. Seriously, it takes a whole period for everybody in exam to take it. Good Luck

Anyway year after year she did nothing to reduce her exams. She will tell you that she wants to know if you understand material, yet why does she give two problems with pedigrees or chi analysis? One problem I guess is not enough. So almost the whole class will take exam until the end of a class and many will not complete at least one question.

I just had to drop her class. My recommendation is DON'T TAKE HER CLASS!!!!!! Yes she is a good professor and always answers a lot of questions. BUT, her exams are horribly LONG! And the worst thing is that she knows it because she will tell you that students in her class usually have problem with finishing her exam.

She covers everything and is available and approachable for after class help. This is one of those classes where you have to know everything cold if you want to pass, especially since the tests have an element of time pressure.
Ridiculous exams. Even if you actually know the stuff well but she seems very picky about your anwsers. The duration of the exams was really an issue.

She's a very good lecturer, and she gives useful homework sets. Absolutely ridiculous exams. Expect to regurgitate everything on her slides word-for-word or face partial/no credit. She also doesn't believe in writing exams that will fit in the allotted time. The only hard thing about her exams is finishing.

Cole knows her stuff I'm in further classes in the molgen series and she was definitely the most helpful teacher so far. Her powerpoints keep you engaged and learning the material unlike a lot of teachers in this major. Her midterms are a female dog. You gotta know your stuff cause you have time to barely finish all the questions.

Her teaching for 605 was great and prepared you for the exam, but her 606 exam questions kind of came from nowhere. If it hadn't been for the TA basically telling us some of the material that she would test on (he also gave us word-for-word an 8 pt question) the averages would have been even lower than they were. I moan but she's really pretty good

Dr. Cole taught the first half of my MOL GEN 605 course and her portion of the material was taught the best by far. Her exam questions were very fair and her problem sets were great practice. I'm very happy she's teaching part of my 606 course as well! The only criticism is her reluctance to throw out a tricky question nearly the whole class missed
No Comments
he is a super nice guy but not the best at teaching and his tests are super hard

He is really interested in the material, but his lectures are so boring it's hard to listen to. He gives you a hard copy of the notes, which is nice, as well as study guides for each chapter. He's nice, but boring lectures and hard tests. To prepare, go over his study guides, old tests, and his online quizzes, as he sometimes repeats questions.
Hollick seems to be really into the material but is incapable of making it interesting to students. Very nice guy but maybe not the best teacher. Read the textbook and take your own notes
Hollick's lectures are boring, but he's a nice guy and eager to meet with students during office hours. When preparing for his exams, READ THE BOOK.

The class is only out of 100 points. There are 4 exams and the lowest score gets dropped, each exam in 25% of your grade. Be prepared for them. The questions are pretty intense and in my experience are not like the practice problems she gives so buy the textbook and review it pretty heavily. She is pretty funny, cracking jokes, in lectures.

Dr. Wu was a very kind person and okay lecturer, but she did make the textbook optional-however GET IT. A lot of similar questions to the exams and diagrams are in the textbook, so if you read, highlight, and study the textbook properly, you will do well on exams. She drops 1 out of the 4 exams, which is very helpful. Make sure to study the slides!

Professor Wu is so funny. Her class is pretty boring, and not exceptionally easy, but she definitely makes it more fun. Tophat is taken for participation and then there are 7 online quizzes and 4 exams (she drops the lowest grade). Just go through all the slides, rewrite the material, and use her study guides and you will be fine.

Very basic chemistry/organic chemistry/biochemistry. I have already taken all three classes at OSU as a pre-med so this class was easy for me. That being said, she is HORRIBLE at explaining concepts so Id highly recommend utilizing other resources. She is also very sassy and doesnt understand how extra credit works. Good luck!

Dr. Wu really does want whats best for you, but sometimes she seems pretty frazzled when you ask her questions. Her powerpoints and quizzes are super easy and nicely laid out, but the exams are a completely different beast. A lot of teaching yourself, but if you like bio, chem, and physiology, then you will do well.

Dr. Wu is a great professor who helps her students in so many ways like constantly updating how she makes her study guides and letting you review your exams afterwards. Prepare to understand her lectures, not just memorize it. Always ask questions bc she does answer them.

Dr. Wu is a very fair professor. Go to class because there is top hat every lecture for points. Reviewing her slides before lecture is a good idea. Exams are alright if you keep up with the material in the class.

Dr. Wu is a solid lecturer - she can be a little tough to follow at times, but that's largely due to the material. She clearly wants students to succeed, and she's always available by email or office hours for extra help. Provides all her lectures online and study guides for exams.

Dr. Wu is a great professor! She makes all of the concepts straightforward, and her tests are very fair and set up for you to succeed. I recommend going to class to get the attendance points and in class question points, but all of the powerpoints are posted on carmen.

one of the easiest science classes i have taken.  If you have a strong background in chem and bio this class will be a breeze.  Tests come straight off the lectures and quizzes .  not very many points though so make sure you get all of the attendance and quiz points

Hardest class I have ever taken. She tries to help but it is just impossible. I take good notes and read the textbook but her exams are difficult. The average grade on all our midterms was around 50%. Good Luck.

She can be a tough grader but what do you expect when the tests are online and open internet... She was a great, kind professor, and always wanted to help. I was out for 2 weeks towards the end of the semester due to a hospitalization and she was so lenient on assignments and considerate. TAKE HER.

Nice as a person, but her teaching style wasn't my cup of tea. She graded harshly on the labs even though she would give you the answers if you asked her during lab. She definitely cares about her students, I highly recommend going to her office hours, even just to grab a snack! Lots of extra credit opportunities.

Exams are difficult but she is very fair. Gives us extra credit after every exam if we review our grades and talk about how to improve. Met with me to talk about my grades and anxiety and how she could help. Gives a lot of material to study for exams. Difficult but not impossible.
The lectures were horrible and the exams were difficult. The practice done in classes was not similar to the exams.

Dr. Petreaca is an excellent and caring professor. She prioritizes the main ideas despite over-explaining at times. Success in her courses requires effort outside of class. I recommend asking questions and completing her problem sets. Exams can be difficult, but she usually curves them and provides extra credit through exam reflections.

This class should've been worth more credits than it is. The material is difficult and her teaching style didn't help it. The tests at least covered the material we went over in class. She dives deep into the material and lectures on things not covered in the test. Most people were getting between 60%-70% on all but one test.

This class was an elective for my major, but, this has been one of the hardest classes I've taken. Although attendance isn't mandatory, it's impossible to pass without lectures. The class has quizzes on readings, packback, mastering, and tophat. The exams were horrible. Overall, this class was too difficult for a nonmajors molecular genetics class.

One of the hardest classes I've ever taken. The average on the exams is always a low 70 or 60. Not sure how that is productive at all. Lectures are so boring and so much material is presented at once. There are only diagrams on the slides which are not helpful because no explanations. Class is frustrated and she just smiles when we are struggling.

Dr. Petreaca is a very knowledgable professor. She does a good job getting the content across to students, but I definitely encourage taking advantage of her extra review problems she posts along and asking plenty of questions. Genetics is a difficult topic to grasp, but Dr. Petreaca was able to facilitate a well organized online class regardless!
Very test heavy. Frankly, I felt frustrated many times throughout the course because many things were not clearly explained. Lectures were scattered and unorganized

Literally the worst class ever the first exam was so difficult and mainly chemistry focused? Like what the Hell ? She teaches at osu Marion and expects us to know so much when literally its supposed to be an introductory biology class? I dont get it AVOID!!! THIS!!! GIRL!!!! PLEASE!

Dr. Petreaca was a great professor! She is extremely knowledgeable about genetics! Her lectures are very thorough and detailed. Although her exams are difficult, she does curve the overall course to be fairly distributed. She is very caring about her students and her cats are also super cute!

Dr. Petreaca is one of my favorite professors. She is very caring and is willing to help outside of class. She gives 2 bonus points per quiz and exam reflection if you go to her office hours. She drops your lowest exam and replaces it with your average exam grades. She replies back to emails fairly quickly and will answer all of your questions.

Melissa is one of the top three professors I have had in college. She is incredibly thoughtful and caring, and accommodated me many times when I had conflicts with class. Her exams are fairly difficult but she does take that in to account and curves a decent amount. I wish every professor could be like her. 12/10 great prof

Dr.Bannerman really cares about her students. She's one of the best professors I've had in my four years at OSU. I'm not in the MEDLBS program but took MEDLBS5100 as an elective for Health Sciences and did not regret it at all. There is a lot of material in this course so study in advance and go to lectures and you will be fine.

Its was an OK experience. Cant complain much about it. Read the material, go to lecture and do well on exams. Felt like some of the stuff was unnecessarily complicated and could have been made easier. Overall it was alright. I have had way way worst courses. Compare to them this one is a gem.
